Timothy N. Jones wrote:

> Is anyone aware of a server-side mock/stub/whatever store and/or
> transport for JavaMail?  I'd like to develop some unit tests for my
> client-side code that could run even if a mail server was not running.
> Something like the DSML JNDI provider which I use for LDAP testing would
> be ideal.

Check Google. There's an article using an in-memory SMTP server. Maybe 
from there you can find something POP3-related.

The bad side of using JavaMail is that it uses class-level methods in 
Transport. I generally wrap that sucker in an interface to avoid direct 
dependency on such a lunatic design choice.
